Award.AwardTitle: Young Professional Forum (HTMC9 and GFMAT 2016); Toronto, Canada; June 26 to July 1, 2016

Division.LongName: Div Of Civil, Mechanical, & Manufact Inn

Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides support for the Young Professionals Forum at the 9th International Conference on High Temperature Ceramic Matrix Composites (HTMC 9), held in conjunction with the Global Forum on Advanced Materials and Technologies for Sustainable Development (GFMAT 2016), in Toronto, Canada, June 26 - July 1, 2016. The focus of this symposium will is on recent societal challenges, including but not limited to energy, health, and environmental aspects. In addition, novel material design paradigms are needed to fabricate materials with multifunctional applications that can bring solutions to some of today's biggest problems. This symposium will bring together young researchers and scientists from around the globe to discuss new approaches and challenges in materials synthesis and to provide a platform for intensive exchange of ideas, knowledge, and networking. The award is jointly supported by the Materials Engineering and Processing (MEP) Program and the Office of International Science and Engineering (OISE).

The award supports participation in the Young Professionals Forum of early career scientists as well as students. The PIs will seek in particular to encourage participation by attendees from underrepresented groups. In addition to the exchange of scientific information and knowledge in the technical sessions, mentoring sessions for young scientists will be arranged.

POR.DRECONTENT:
We gave travel support to US based students to attend the 9th International Conference on   High Temperature Ceramic   Matrix Composites – HTCMC 9 and Global Forum on Advanced Materials and Technologies for Sustainable Development. It was organized by the American Ceramics Society (ACeRs) in Toronto, Ontario Canada (Jun 26 – Jul 1, 2016). More particularly, students were encouraged to attend the Young Professional Forum (YPF), write professional blogs for ACeRs, and the theme of the conference was, “ Next-generation materials for multifunctional applications and sustainable development, and concurrent societal challenges in the new millennium”.

Following advertisement was posted for the application , “Application is invited for NSF Sponsored travel stipend to US based graduate students, post docs, and early career professionals within 5 years of their PhD to attend Young Professional Forum in 9th International Conference on   High Temperature Ceramic   Matrix Composites – HTCMC 9 and Global Forum on Advanced Materials and Technologies for Sustainable Development. During the symposium, scientists from multicultural background will present their results. In addition, mentoring sessions will be organized for young professionals. The critical criteria for selection will be: (a) top priority will be given to researcher who are presenting, and (b) students, postdocs, and Early Career Scientists. Travel stipends can be used for cost associated with travel and each travel stipend will be around $1000. It also entails that participants will write a 1-page summary regarding what they learnt from the conference and symposium, and how they want the Young Professional Forum to be improved in future. Please contact symposium organizer Dr. Surojit Gupta (email – surojit.gupta@engr.und.edu) for more information.”

Following students were selected for the program:

Yiyu Li: Alfred University

Yin Liu: Alfred University

Zhezhen Fu: Southern Illinois University Carbondale

Michael Presby: University of Akron

Rabih Mansour: University of Akron

Tyler Colling: Georgia Institute of Technology

Matt Fuka: University of North Dakota

Johnny Nelson: University of North Dakota
